question: A server administrator is configuring storage for a Windows-based virtualization host. The administrator wants to use a storage protocol that provides block-level storage and utilizes the existing network infrastructure. Which of the following storage protocols should be deployed?

A corporation is implementing a cloud model that must meet security and privacy requirements for application development and testing. The company would like to use its own hardware to save money. Which of the following cloud models should be deployed?
A technician just provisioned a new Windows server and has noticed the IP address is 169.254.0.1. Which of the following should the technician verify first?
A server in the datacenter reportedly has a BSOD and is not responding. The server needs to be rebooted. Which of the following is the best method to reboot the server remotely?
Which of the following license quantities is required for five dual-socket servers with 10-core processors in a core-based licensing model?
A systems administrator noticed a new network card is not being recognized by the operating system. Which of the following is most likely the cause?
A technician is installing a large number of servers in a data center with limited rack space. Which of the following would accomplish this goal while using the least amount of space?
A technician is configuring a server that will only be used for FTP. For security purposes, all other ports will be disabled. Which of the following ports will need to be enabled? (Choose two.)
Under which of the following should a technician implement scripting?
Which of the following backup types would be most useful when restoring a failed physical server to new hardware?

After a recent patch update to the HVAC system, several servers within the data center are experiencing random system crashes and performance issues. The server administrator notices environmental alarms are going off within the room. Which of the following should the administrator do to improve server performance and stop the environmental alarms while minimizing the impact to production data?

choices.text: Implement a temporary cooling system in the data center.
Use compressed air to clean out all the servers in the data center.
Run hardware diagnostics on each server and then perform manual reboots.
Silence environmental alerts and keep the data center open to improve airflow.

question: A receptionist at a company is worried about cars driving through the front entrance of the building. The Chief Executive Officer requests that the administrator mitigate this risk. Which of the following should the administrator recommend?

A server needs to be configured with an IP address on two different network segments. The server has only one network interface. The network team has configured a trunk link to the server, and the administrator has installed the advanced driver package. After applying both IP addresses to the adapter, the administrator is unable to establish connections into either network. Which of the following is the fastest way to resolve this issue?

choices.text: Change the default gateway to the second segment.
Configure VLAN interfaces on the server.
Install an additional NIC in the server.
Enable NIC teaming and bridge the segments.

question: Multiple users have reported an issue accessing files on a specific server. Which of the following should be the first step in troubleshooting this issue?

choices.text: Notify the key stakeholders of an outage.
Immediately execute a backup of the server.
Identify changes made to the environment.
Correct the permissions on the folder containing the files.

question: An administrator connects a server to an external gigabit switch, but the server can only get a speed of 100Mbps. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this issue?

A Windows server has experienced a BSOD, and the administrator needs to monitor the reboot. The server is in a datacenter with no OOB management. Which of the following tools should the administrator use to complete this task?
Which of the following should a server administrator configure to ensure access to motherboard software is restricted?

A manufacturer's website states that end-of-life support for its products is four years after the end-of-sale announcement. The end-of-sale announcement was released last year for a legacy application server that is experiencing slow performance on the network. Upon further investigation, the server administrator notices the server is missing several OS and software updates. Due to current budget constraints, no major investments will be made for the next 18 months. Which of the following should the server administrator do to improve performance on the server while minimizing downtime?

choices.text: Stop and restart the application services.
Reload the OS with updated patches and reinstall legacy software to match the current version.
Purchase a new system to replace the legacy server prior to the end-of-life date.
Patch the server to the most recent minor updates that are available.
Boot the server into safe mode and uninstall old patches to make room for new updates.

question: An administrator is upgrading a group of legacy blade servers to the latest version of hypervisor. After restarting the server, the upgrade is interrupted. The hypervisor is not available, and the update is not successful. Which of the following should the administrator do next to accomplish this upgrade?

choices.text: Change the upgrade to a new installation and overwrite the boot drive.
Upgrade the blade server's firmware to support the new hypervisor.
Increase the blade server's onboard RAM.

question: A systems administrator notices the fans are running at full speed in a newly upgraded server. Which of the following should be done to address this issue?

A technician needs to install a Type 1 hypervisor on a server. The technician needs to maximize the drive space available on the best performing drives for guest systems. The server has SD card slots, a SAS controller, and a SATA controller, and it is attached to a NAS. On which of the following drive types should the technician install the hypervisor?

A company uses Linux as a server OS. The company has been growing, and the number of Linux servers has increased. The IT management team would like to implement an automation tool to make it easier to manage configuration, deployment, OS patching, and software installation. They do not want to install any additional agents on the servers. Which of the following would be the best tool to use to achieve this goal?
Two servers are being configured for high availability in a cluster. Both servers will be running applications at the same time. Which of the following is the name for this feature?

An administrator receives an alert that an application server is offline. The administrator uses a crash cart to determine the server is disconnected from the network. The administrator verifies the network cable and NIC are both functioning properly. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

choices.text: The firewall on the server is misconfigured.

question: An administrator is monitoring a web server and notices that it is not showing as up. During the previous night's maintenance window, the 1GB NIC was replaced with a 10GB NIC. When the administrator checks the server, the web service is running. The administrator pings the server and receives the following output: Destination host unreachable - Which of the following is the most likely issue?

choices.text: The default gateway on the new NIC is incorrect.
The technician did not properly remove the old NIC configuration.
The core switch has a routing issue.

question: A technician is connecting power cables to a high-power server that consumes 17 amps of power per power supply. Which of the following connector types would be used for this situation?

An administrator is unable to get server updates from a WSUS server. However, the administrator was able to patch the server successfully last month. Which of the following should the administrator check first?

choices.text: The software firewall on the local server
Stopped services on the local server
The primary DNS IP address assigned to the server
The hosts file on the local server

question: Which of the following are used to protect a building from a vehicle trying to enter without authorization?

An administrator is writing a script to update a setting on 100 servers. The required steps and syntax are the same on all the servers, except for the server name. Which of the following scripting techniques will most likely be used to implement this setting change?
Which of the following is the number of licenses required for ten quad CPU servers with 12-core processors in a socket-based licensing model?
Which of the following are examples of external threats to a company? (Choose two.)

A technician is troubleshooting a database server that has 12 external disk arrays. Multiple disks are in a degraded state. The server is in a remote, colocation facility and has on-site support. The technician notices all of the external storage arrays are degraded, but the internal arrays are functional. Which of the following steps should the technician take next to quickly address this issue?

choices.text: Notify the users of the downtime and reboot the server from the RDP connection.
Notify the management team about the issue and travel to the colocation site with spare disks and RAID controllers.
Access the server with RDP and start the RAID utility software to rebuild the arrays.
Restore the data for the affected disks and notify the users of the estimated recovery time.

question: A recently deployed server is experiencing significant connection issues after being plugged into the network switch. An administrator was asked to review the server configuration and finds the following: 10Gb server NIC with 50 micron optic installed 10m single mode fiber patch cable to the switch 10Gb switch interface with short range optic installed Which of the following steps should the administrator take next?

choices.text: Replace the switch optic with one that supports MMF.
Replace the server NIC with one compatible with a single-mode fiber.
Replace the optic in the server with a short-range optic.
Replace the fiber cable with a 32.8ft (10m) OM4 cable.

question: A technician is migrating a legacy application to a virtualized environment. Which of the following methods would accomplish this task?
Which of the following would protect data in transit?

An administrator is troubleshooting a performance issue with an application. The application performs many small reads and writes in its operation. The administrator determines that the underlying storage is currently configured to use a general-purpose array with RAID 5. Which of the following should the administrator consider doing in order to offer higher application performance yet still retain data protection?

choices.text: Move the application to an array using RAID 0.
Move the application to an array using RAID 1
Move the application to an array using RAID 6.
Move the application to an array using RAID 10.

question: A database developer recently requested a 4TB SATA drive utilizing spinning disks be added to an existing system for a new, heavily used database. The storage administrator turned down the request after reviewing it. Which of the following is the most likely reason the administrator did that?

choices.text: The drive is not capable of deduplication.
The drive would have slow I/O performance.
The drive is not compatible with the server OS.

question: A systems administrator is performing a routine update to a server. The administrator applies the update, restarts the server, and then conducts routine testing that reveals the critical functionality provided by the server is unavailable. Event logs indicate a core service is failing to start. The service is configured to start automatically, and rolling back the update does not correct the issue. Which of the following is most likely causing the service failure?

choices.text: The server requires another reboot to complete the rollback.
The administrator is not authorized to run the service.
The server requires further updates of other software components.
The account used to run the service has expired.

question: A server monitoring solution is reporting high CPU utilization in a server located in the perimeter network. The Command Prompt and Task Manager both freeze when being opened. Which of the following would be the likely cause?

A server recently started sending error messages about running out of memory while in use. After a maintenance period during which more memory was added, the server is still unable to consistently remain powered on. Which of the following should the technician check first?
